name: test_e2e_with_logs[088_SQLI_POLY_004]
description:
## Attack Pattern Information

| Item | Value |
|------|-------|
| **Pattern ID** | `SQLI_POLY_004` |
| **Name** | MySQL polyglot version extraction |
| **Category** | SQLI |
| **Subcategory** | polyglot |
| **Severity** | `HIGH` |

## Attack Details

- **Payload**: `1'+(select*from(select name_const(@@version,0))a)+'1`
- **Encoded**: `1%27%2B%28select%2Afrom%28select%20name_const%28%40%40version%2C0%29%29a%29%2B%271`
- **Expected Detection**: Yes

## Test Execution Results

- **Status**: `PASSED`
- **Detection Count**: 1 / 1
- **Latency**: ~39000ms
- **Timestamp**: 20:37:37.000 UTC

## Rule Mapping

| Item | Value |
|------|-------|
| **Expected Rule** | `[NGINX SQLi] Error-based SQL Injection` |
| **Matched Rule** | `[NGINX SQLi] Error-based SQL Injection test_id=SQLI_POLY_004-1770842257101-833bvr pattern_id=SQLI_POLY_004 uri=/?q=1%27%2B%28select%2Afrom%28select%20name_const%28%40%40version%2C0%29%29a%29%2B%271 client=127.0.0.1 method=GET` |
| **Rule Match** | ✅ Match |
